function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Indoor environment quality mediating the impact of the built environment on residents’ health.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Densely populated environments increase exposure to pathogens","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective infection control and prevention measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of research and understanding of pandemic viruses","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spreading of coronavirus disease 2019 covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Indoor airborne transmission of viruses","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High association of covid-19 infection with air pollution","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential for transmission of contagious diseases in shared office spaces and co-working environments.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High density in offices and shared facilities leading to increased risk of disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reluctance to use elevators in high-rise buildings due to disease transmission concerns.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The potential for ongoing covid-19 pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty about the long-term effects and changes in the built environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The need for transformative changes in physical spaces to mitigate future virus attacks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on a single antivirus strategy","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of flexibility and responsiveness in addressing pandemics","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient preparation for future pandemics","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased density in urban areas leading to higher risk of contagious disease spread","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on telecommuting and digital communication leading to reduced social interaction","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertainty about the long-term impact of the pandemic and future social effects","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of design to limit effects of pandemics in the built environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in architecture and urban planning due to fear of infection","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cities being tested during the pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of sustainable development goals focused on human health","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased virtual and augmented reality use may lead to prolonged screen time and potential health issues.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unclear long-term impact of increased remote working on mental health and social connections.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Implementation of touchless technologies may create a false sense of security and lead to neglect of other hygiene practices.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Possible influx of covid-19 patients in temporary hospitals","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential infection risks within the built environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risks associated with nanomaterials and nanotechnology","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Modular construction strategy increasing the spread of covid-19 infection due to the movement and assembly of prefabricated components from different locations.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Adaptive reuse strategy leading to the potential exposure of workers and healthcare professionals to contaminated materials or surfaces from the existing structures being converted.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of increased contagion in multi-story buildings due to high contact surfaces like elevator buttons and door handles","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of poor indoor air quality leading to sick-building syndrome","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of overwhelmed healthcare systems and inadequate medical facilities","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decentralization may lead to inefficient distribution of resources and services, making it difficult to provide adequate healthcare and education in certain areas.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequately planned urban farming may lead to environmental degradation and unsustainable land use practices.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased cycling and walking infrastructure without proper safety measures may lead to higher risk of accidents and injuries.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High population density increases the risk of contagious diseases spread in cities","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Controversy surrounding the impact of higher density on social interactions and sustainability","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased density in offices due to altered office spaces and remote working policies","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased cost and inefficiency of high-rise buildings due to altered office space requirements","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effective cleaning policies leading to increased spread of infection","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Crowded living conditions leading to the spread of communicable diseases","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of social isolation and protection from viruses in housing","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate office space for remote working","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Extended time indoors could lead to increased risk of contagious disease transmission within housing and office spaces.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adaptation in housing and office design to accommodate workspaces and reduce density could lead to prolonged health risks and reduced productivity.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient construction strategies and materials could contribute to suboptimal building designs and delay the implementation of health-conscious features.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to working from home for some people based on socioeconomic status, leading to challenges in social distancing and infection prevention.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges with social distancing and infection prevention in smaller and crowded houses or spaces without outside areas.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"}]}
